description.narrative: By end of 2018, the water and sanitation policy document is validated and disseminated and implementation tools available, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, 100 per cent girls/boys of primary school and 70% girls/boys of 1st cycle of secondary school, particularly the most vulnerable, achieve quality and inclusive education, and 100% girls/boys and adolescents out of formal school benefit from alternative education.

mailing-address.narrative: D.34 Rue Lucien Fourneau Boite Postale 2110 Brazzaville

System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: 93 non-formal education teachers have been trained and 7,973 vulnerable and disadvantaged students (3,780 girls and 4,193 boys) were enrolled in the Likouala, Niari and Sangha regions, an increase of three per cent with respect to 2018. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/02/2020
